content:
• Monday, February 13, 2017
  • CCI

    Crown Castle borrows $500M to mostly repay revolving credit

    • Crown Castle International (CCI +3.1%) has borrowed an additional $500M and stretched out the maturity date on its credit.
    • The company borrowed that sum in Tranche A term loans, used proceeds to repay outstanding revolving borrowings, and has extended the maturity of its senior unsecured credit to Jan. 21, 2022.
    • That facility has a $2.5B revolving credit facility and now a $2.5B term loan A facility.
    • After the moves, there's about $2.4B in availability under the revolver.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM
  • ATVI

    Activision comes off highs as Hilliard Lyons goes bearish

    • Activision Blizzard (ATVI -3.2%) has given back some gains after Friday's sharp move up on record earnings, and Hilliard Lyons is one firm that's giving more play to conservative guidance from the videogame maker.
    • Hilliard's Jeffrey Thomison has cut his rating to Underperform ahead of a "down year," reducing expectations for 2017 EPS to $1.92 from $2.20 (vs. consensus $1.94), and for revenue of $6.33B from $7.2B (vs. consensus of $6.4B).
    • Activision's own full-year guidance is for $6.3B in revenue and $1.85 in EPS. “While we feel this guidance is conservative, we also believe it reflects maturation of certain console franchises,” Thomison writes.
    • “In sum, we believe 2017 is shaping up to be a down year for ATVI’s revenues and earnings, while the stock price is at an all-time high and valuation is near the upper end of a historical range. Given that 2018 prospects seem considerably more attractive, we believe better investment opportunities could surface later this year,” he adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM | 15 Comments
  • NBL

    Noble Energy rises after stronger than expected Q4

    • Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) +1.3% AH after reporting much better than expected Q4 earnings on 17% higher revenues Y/Y, helped by lower expenses and higher oil prices.
    • NBL says Q4 total sales volumes fell 2.8% Y/Y to 410K boe/day but at the top end of its guidance range, while the average realized price for crude oil jumped 22% and its realized price for natural gas rose 20%; total operating expenses fell 46% to $1.37B after FY 2016 spending dropped 15% to $4.8B from $5.7B in 2015.
    • NBL expects FY 2017 sales volumes to average 415K-425K boe/day, up ~9% Y/Y, including sales from newly acquired Clayton Williams Energy, with the expected closing of the deal in Q2.
    • NBL also forecasts 2017 organic capex of $2.3B-$2.6B.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • VZ

    Analysts: Verizon's unlimited play a bad omen for sector

    • All four major U.S. wireless carriers dropped today in the wake of Verizon's return to offering unlimited data plans, and analysts tend to agree that the move will mess up economics for all of them.
    • Verizon (NYSE:VZ) shares fell 0.9% today, while AT&T (NYSE:T) dropped 1.8%, Sprint (NYSE:S) slipped 1.3% and T-Mobile (NASDAQ:TMUS) -- a net taker of customers from Verizon that emphasizes its unlimited pricing -- fell a full 2.4%.
    • Reactions to Verizon's plan note its expense (more so than T-Mobile or Sprint) and aggressive speed throttling after users pass a data cap (common among carriers' "unlimited" plans).
    • Evercore has a Hold rating on Verizon, and notes that throttling users at 22 GB in a month and at 10 GB of hotspot use is an "incremental negative for all carriers." The move will be accretive to ARPU at first, says Vijay Jayant, but dilutive in the long term as customers' bills stay put even as usage rises.
    • Instinet's Jeffrey Kvaal reiterated a Neutral rating and says the move may be a "nail in the coffin" for revenue growth: "For T-Mobile and Sprint, the potential for reduced top-line growth is less of a concern as investors focus on Adjusted EBITDA and FCF. AT&T and Verizon, however, must pursue growth outside the industry." And while AT&T is counting on DirecTV and Time Warner, Verizon's flat guidance suggests a need for inorganic options.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM | 95 Comments
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power to deploy 20 zero-emission fuel cell electric buses in California

    • Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) +4.5% AH on news it has joined a consortium with New Flyer Industries to deploy 20 zero-emission fuel cell electric buses in California.
    • BLDP will provide 20 of its FCveloCity-HD 85 KW fuel cell engines to New Flyer, North America's largest transit bus and motor coach manufacturer and parts distributor, and the engines will power New Flyer 40-foot Xcelsior XHE40 fuel cell buses, which are planned to be delivered by year-end 2018.
    • The FCEBCC project is funded and sponsored by the California Air Resources Board, the Bay Area Air Quality Management District, and the South Coast Air Quality Management District.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • RNG

    RingCentral -9% despite Q4 earnings beat

    • RingCentral (NYSE:RNG) is off 9% now after hours following Q4 earnings where it beat expectations on top and bottom lines, but provided earnings-call profit guidance on the light side for the upcoming quarter.
    • Overall revenue was up 25.2% and software subscriptions (the bulk of revenue) rose 28% to $98M.
    • Annualized exit recurring software subscriptions grew 31% to $414.4M; of that, ARR for RingCentral Office grew 38%, to $341.5M. Gross margin on software subscriptions rose to 81.2% on a non-GAAP basis.
    • The company guided to software revenue of $102M-$103M for Q1 (28-29% growth) and total revenue of $109.5M-$111.5M, above consensus for $106.7M. It's expecting EPS of $0.01-$0.03, vs. consensus for $0.03.
    • For the full year, it's forecasting software revenue of $447M-$454M (26-28% growth) and total revenue of $484M-$492M, above consensus for $468M. It sees EPS of $0.13-$0.17 vs. consensus for $0.15.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMKR

    Amkor Technology -9.5%; Q1 2017 revenue outlook negative, seasonal smartphone market slowdown noted

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $1.02B (+52.1% Y/Y, $20M below estimates), EPS $0.42 (consensus $0.27), gross margin 22.2% (vs. 19.7% Q/Q, 15.3% Y/Y), net income $100M (vs. $60M Q/Q, -$11M Y/Y), EBITDA $280M (vs. $248M Q/Q, $130M Y/Y), net cash provided by operating activities $238M (vs. $219M Q/Q, $154M Y/Y), free cash flow $117M (vs. $106M Q/Q, -$29M Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $860M-$940M (-8% to -16% Q/Q; consensus $964.48M), EPS -$0.11 to $0.05 (consensus $0.11), gross margin 13%-17%
    • FY 2017 projections – capital expenditures approximately $500M
    • Amkor Technology president and CEO Steve Kelley: "The consolidation of J-Devices and the success of our automotive, Greater China and advanced SiP initiatives fueled the growth in revenue, which in turn drove significantly improved profitability and cash flow."
    • Although citing smartphone market slowdown, demand in other markets is claimed healthy.
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:AMKR) $9.45
    • Presentation slides
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM

  • TRXC

    Transenterix +5%, first clinical use of Senhance overseas

    • The company has begun clinical use of the Senhance Robotic Surgical System in France.
    • The first case - a hysterectomy for endometrial cancer with pelvic lymphadenectomy - was performed on Feb. 7. Surgery was successful and the patient discharged less than 24 hours after the procedure.
    • TRXC +5.2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • INCY

    Lilly and Incyte's baricitinib OK'd in Europe; Incyte earns $65M milestone

    • Incyte (NASDAQ:INCY) is up 1% after hours on light volume in response to the news that the European Commission has approved Olumiant (baricitinib) for the treatment of moderately-to-severely active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in adult patients who have failed to respond adequately to or are intolerant of disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs).
    • Baricitinib is the first JAK inhibitor to be approved in the EU to treat RA. It is being developed with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) under a 2009 exclusive global license and collaboration agreement.
    • The approval triggers a $65M milestone payment from Lilly to Incyte.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDTI

    GigPeak +12.18%; Integrated Device Technology acquiring for $3.08 per share

    • Accompanying release of GigPeak's Q4 2016 report, disclosure is made Integrated Device Technology plans to acquire GigPeak in a $250M all-cash deal, unanimously approved by the boards of both companies and expected for accretion to Integrated Device Technology earnings within the first full quarter subsequent transaction close (expected calendar Q2 2017).
    • Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) $24.50, -0.93% after hours, GigPeak (NYSEMKT:GIG) $3.04.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • PFLT

    PennantPark Floating Rate -2.7% on capital raise

    • The company is selling 5M shares in a secondary offering, with underwriters offered a 750K share greenshoe option.
    • PennantPark (NASDAQ:PFLT) last week reported end-of-year NAV of $14.11 and closed today at $14.01.
    • Shares are down 2.7% after hours to $13.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 25 Comments
  • OMF

    OneMain -3.7%; earnings miss, delinquencies rise

    • Consumer and Insurance segment adjusted pretax earnings of $175M up from $143M a year ago. EPS of $0.80 vs. $0.66. Expectations were for $0.81.
    • Net finance receivables of $13.5B up from $13B; net charge-off ratio of 7.5%.
    • The 30-89 day delinquency ratio of 2.3% at year end slipped from 2.6% three months earlier, and was up from 2.2% a year ago.
    • The 60+ delinquency ratio of 3.6% at year end was up from 3.3% three months earlier and from 3% a year ago.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 8 ET
    • Previously: OneMain Holdings EPS of $0.20 (Feb. 13)
    • OMF -3.7% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand +4.87%; Q4 2016 positive, revenue outlook below estimates

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $109.03M (+13.6% Y/Y, $0.52M above estimates), EPS $0.00 ($0.04 above estimates), billings $156.3M (+10.1% Y/Y), operating loss $14.5M (vs. $14.8M operating loss Y/Y), operating income $1.6M (vs. $0.2M Y/Y), net loss $18.6M (vs. $18.8M net loss Y/Y), free cash flow $27.5M (vs. $49.2M Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $109M-$111M (consensus $113.87M)
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $475M-$485M (consensus $488.63M), operating margin 5%-6%, net income margin 4%-5%, free cash flow 6%-7% of revenue
    • Cornerstone OnDemand president and CEO Adam Miller: "We believe the tremendous market opportunity in learning and human capital management, combined with our position as the long-standing talent management leader and our proven ability to innovate, will continue to fuel Cornerstone’s long-term growth and margin expansion."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:CSOD) $41.97
    • Supplemental data
    • Conference call

  • GEVO

    Gevo -22% after announcing public offering

    • Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) -22.3% AH after announcing a proposed public offering of common stock and warrants of an unspecified size.
    • Gevo says it plans to use 15% of the proceeds from the offering to pay down part of its outstanding 10% convertible senior secured notes due 2017, with the rest to be used to fund working capital and for other general corporate purposes.
    • Gevo also says it is extending the maturity date of the 2017 notes to June 23 from March 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 16 Comments
  • NVTA

    Invitae beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Invitae (NYSE:NVTA): Q4 EPS of -$0.69 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $9.2M (+191.1% Y/Y) beats by $0.38M.
    • Shares +2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior slumps more than 5% after gloomy outlook

    • CEO Andy Smith: "We are operating in a difficult environment with intense supply pressure and a competitive labor market ... supply and labor pressures will continue for the majority of 2017."
    • The company reported adjusted EBITDA for Q4 of $184.2M, up 3.5% Y/Y. Excluding integration, transaction, transaction-related and strategic project costs, adjusted EBITDA in Q4 was $194.2M.
    • Adjusted free cash flow of $33.2M was up $65.9M from a year ago.
    • Adjusted CFFO of $81.5M down 7.1% Y/Y.
    • Full-year outlook: Adjusted EBITDA excl. costs of $670M-$710M vs. $825M in 2016; adjusted free cash flow of $140M-$170M.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 10 ET
    • BKD -5.65% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 5 Comments
  • KOOL

    Cesca Therapeutics reports FQ2 results

    • Cesca Therapeutics (NASDAQ:KOOL): FQ2 Net loss of $3.4M.
    • Revenue of $4M (+21.2% Y/Y)
    • Shares +6.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • INOV

    Inovalon fails to push through two downgrades; shares off 9%

    • Inovalon Holdings (INOV -8.8%) appears that it will end the session in the red after Bank of America downgraded it to Underperform with a $10 (11% downside risk) price target and Wells Fargo downgraded it to Market Perform.
    • BofA analyst Steven Vallquette cites the drop in health plans from exchanges as a key negative plus lower enrollment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • KS

    Containerboard price increase on the radar

    • BMO Capital says KapStone Paper and Packaging Corp (KS +1.4%) boosted containerboard prices by $50 per ton for the spring season.
    • KapStone was up over 2% earlier, but has peeled back. International Paper (IP -0.3%) and Packaging Corp of America (PKG +0.9%) have also hit reverse after a mid-day spike.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • CECE

    CECO Environmental -9% as Spruce Point predicts covenant breach

    • CECO Environmental (CECE -8.9%) plunges nearly 10% following a negative report from Spruce Point Capital, which calls the stock a Strong Sell and discloses a short position.
    • Spruce Point says it believes CECO is at "high risk" of a covenant breach in 2017, citing its forensic financial analysis, insider behavior and anticipated changes in the regulatory environment driving its business.
    • CECO has said its current net debt to EBITDA ratio has dropped to 1.6x from 3.6x, but Spruce Point finds problems with the company's “leverage ratio” covenant in its credit agreement, which looks at gross leverage and includes much more debt obligations beyond just its term loan.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 6 Comments

  • Banks lead again; Hatch calls Dodd-Frank 'worse than Obamacare'

    • Dodd-Frank is "an overreach in every way," Senate Finance Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch tells Bloomberg.
    • The post-crisis law treats all banks "like they're a bunch of crooks," and this can't continue.
    • The Financial Sector SPDR (XLF +1%), the SPDR KBW Bank ETF (KBE +1%), the SPDR KBW Regional Banking ETF (KRE +0.9%).
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, UYG, VFH, IYF, BTO, IYG, FNCL, SEF, FXO, RYF, FINU, RWW, XLFS, FINZ, JHMF, FAZZ, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 30 Comments

    Popeyes flys higher with Restaurant Brands on the hunt

    • Restaurant Brands International (QSR +4.5%) has approached Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen (PLKI +12.4%) about a takeover offer, according to Reuters.
    • Sources indicate that talks are still ongoing.
    • Popeyes shot to an all-time high of $74.90 off the buzz.

  • DO

    Diamond Offshore +2% after issuing revised Q4 earnings

    • Diamond Offshore (DO +1.9%) is higher after revising previously announced Q4 earnings, saying its liability for uncertain tax positions in certain foreign jurisdictions did not appropriately reflect changes in foreign exchange rates.
    • DO's Q4 net income rose by $43M, or ~$0.32 per diluted share, and net loss for FY 2016 declined by $43M, or $0.31 per diluted share.
    • DO last week reported Q4 EPS of $0.53, including a $0.26/share benefit attributable to a contract dispute settlement with a client in the North Sea.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • RRR

    Red Rock Resorts pulls share offering, catches buy rating from Aegis

    • Red Rock Resorts (RRR +0.9%) files to withdraw a planned offering of shares.
    • Earlier today, Aegis Capital initiated coverage on Red Rock with a Buy rating and $27 price target.
    • "Given shares trade ~14% below our CY18 target price, we are buyers at current levels but would also look to be more aggressive on any potential share price dip from potential CY17 consensus adjustments stemming from short-term construction disruption to the benefit the portfolio longer-term," writes analyst David Bain.
    • SEC Form RW
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier slapped with Sell rating at Goldman

    • HollyFrontier (HFC -1.5%) is initiated with a Sell rating and a $26 price target at Goldman Sachs, which cites worries about earnings power in the Rocky Mountain refining segment, curtailed buyback potential due to a lack of free cash flow generation, and relatively low refining margins in H1 of this year.
    • Goldman sees substantial downside to HFC's earnings consensus, and now expects EPS of $1.16, $2.04 and $2.42 during 2017-19, down from its previous outlook for a respective $1.65, $2.31 and $3.49, and believes Wall Street is currently modeling overly optimistic expectations for HFC's realized refining margins in light of elevated product inventories and turnarounds.
    • Goldman says it prefers Valero Energy (VLO -0.8%) and Marathon Petroleum (MPC +0.1%) among refiners.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 18 Comments
  • ARKR

    Ark Restaurants breaks higher after earnings

    • Ark Restaurants (ARKR +8.5%) trades higher after posting Q4 results.
    • The company reports same store sales increased 2.7% during the quarter to top the industry average.
    • Ark doubled its operating income to over $1.3M.
    • Shares trade at their highest level in over a month.
    • Previously: Ark Restaurants reports FQ1 results (Feb. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 2 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

  • VWAGY

    Mobileye +8.2%; broad-ranging cooperation with Volkswagen announced

    • Volkswagen (VLKAY) and Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) target implementation of "a new navigation standard for autonomous driving" beginning in 2018.
    • Future Volkswagen models are planned for utilization of Mobileye's Road Experience Management technology, with eventual joint collection of crowd-sourced (swarm) data for advanced mapping purposes also intended.
    • Earlier (February 13, 2017): Mobileye +6.37%; arrangement with Volkswagen reported [updated]
    • Previously (September 14, 2016): Mobileye expects further self-driving car deals in coming months
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 5 Comments

  • BLRX

    BioLineRx perks up 7% on Rodman bullish call

    • Thinly traded nano cap BioLineRx (BLRX +7.3%) is up on more than a 4x surge in volume on the heels of Rodman & Renshaw's initiation of coverage with a Buy rating and $3 (154% upside) price target.
    • The company's lead product candidate is Phase 2-stage cancer therapeutic BL-8040.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy +2% after refinancing credit facility

    • SandRidge Energy (SD +2%) is higher after saying it entered into a new $600M reserve based credit facility, replacing a $425M revolver, with a $425M borrowing base.
    • The agreement also eliminates certain negative covenants, such as the PDP asset coverage ratio, $20M minimum liquidity requirement and limitations on capital expenditures.
    • SD emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy just four months ago, and the new credit facility is another step for the company in returning to growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • ELMD

    Electromed up 21% on heavy volume

    • Thinly traded nano cap Electromed (ELMD +21.4%) heads north on more than a 7x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action other than being a member of the group of tiny companies showing occasional large spikes in price/volume. Many times this behavior presages an equity offering.
    • The company reported fiscal Q2 results on February 8. Its cash balance as of the end of December was ~$4.8M, but cash flow from operations was modestly higher ($38.7K) for the six-month period.
    • Notable was its accounts receivable balance of ~$8.3M, almost 30% higher that FQ2's revenues of ~$6.4M.
    • The Simi Valley, CA-based company develops products that provide airway clearance therapy, such as its SmartVest System.
    • Previously: Electromed up 47% premarket on fiscal Q2 results (Feb. 10, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • GT

    Tire stocks move higher on positive pricing read

    • Tire stocks Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +4%) and Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB +2.1%) are making solid gains today.
    • Bloomberg attributes the rally to positive comments from Ebest Investment analyst Ji-Woong Yoo on pricing.
    • Michelin (OTCPK:MGDDY, [[]MGDDT]) rose over 2% in Paris trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • HCP

    HCP +1.4% after beat, unchanged guidance

    • Q4 adjusted FFO of $276.2M or $0.59 per share vs. $374.9M and $0.80 a year ago. There was the QCP spinoff though. Comparable AFFO per share of $0.53 compares to $0.51 in Q4 one year ago.
    • Dividend is $0.37.
    • Full-year AFFO per share guidance of $1.89-$1.95, with same-property cash NOI growth of 2.5-3.5%. Both ranges are unchanged from guidance first issued in November.
    • After an early dip, HCP now higher by 1.4% on the session.
    • Previously: HCP beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • OXY

    Occidental Petro cut at Mizuho as dividend yield insufficient for upside

    • Occidental Petroleum (OXY -1.9%) is lower as Mizuho downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $70 price target, cut from $87, believing OXY can continue growing its dividend but only at a modest pace, and seeing "few idiosyncratic drivers of stock outperformance."
    • Mizuho cites OXY's rich relative valuation, increasing unit expenses trends through 2016, muted dividend growth and and deteriorating debt and leverage metrics relative to historical standards.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • VWAGY

    Mobileye +6.37%; arrangement with Volkswagen reported [updated]

    • Volkswagen (VLKAY) cooperation involving Mobileye's Road Experience Management [REM] system noted.
    • Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) $46.08.
    • Update: A prior-expected collaboration formally announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • MGEN

    Signal stockholders OK all Miragen merger-related proposals; shares ease 21%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Signal Genetics (SGNL -20.9%) drops on more than a 50% surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 81K shares, in response to its announcement that all Miragen merger-related proposals were approved by stockholders at Friday's special meeting. Miragen stockholders will receive ~0.7031 of a share of Signal for each Miragen share owned.
    • The proposals included the issuance of common stock, the change in control, the change in name to Miragen Therapeutics, a 1:15 reverse stock split, an increase in the number of authorized shared of Signal common to 100M from 50M and the sale of MyPRS assets to Quest Diagnostics.
    • At the closing of the merger, Miragen is expected to receive gross proceeds of $40.7M from investors, increasing the cash balance for the combined firm to ~$61.7M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • VALE

    Report: Brazil politics could keep Ferreira as Vale CEO for two more years

    • Vale's (VALE +7.9%) top non-government shareholders want CEO Murilo Ferreira to stay in his job for another two years to stem pressure from Brazilian politicians to appoint an ally, Reuters reports, citing newspaper Valor Econômico.
    • Members of Brazilian Pres. Temer's PMDB party and Senator Neves of the PSDB party from the mineral-rich Minas Gerais state, where Vale is based, have been vying for months to influence the selection of the new CEO, according to the report.
    • The tension over the Vale job is the latest sign of strain between the two biggest parties in Temer's coalition, as the PSDB and some in Temer's PMDB have clashed over a string of ministry posts and may run rival candidates in Brazil's 2018 presidential election.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    UBS reissues Apple at Buy, considers Services undervalued

    • Analyst Steve Milunovich: "Management has emphasized the importance of services the past year. We consider the installed base and retention rate the primary drivers of device and services value. We also view Apple as a platform vendor with hardware and services intertwined. However, to test the notion that the market underappreciates services, we performed a sum-of-the-parts analysis. If Apple services were valued similarly to PayPal, the stock would be at least 10% higher." Price target $138 (current price $133.64).
    • A strengthening component of Apple's (AAPL +1.2%) business, Services is projected (by Apple) to represent the size of Fortune 100 this year and is targeted to double in size over the next four.
    • Previously (February 10, 2017): Bernstein reiterates Apple at Outperform, addresses Services
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 22 Comments
  • CAB

    Gander Mountain said to be close to bankruptcy filing

    • Gander Mountain is close to filing for bankruptcy, according to Reuters.

  • NUE

    Nucor upgraded, AK Steel downgraded at Morgan Stanley

    • Steelmakers are rallying as China reportedly considers cutting production to fight smog, and Nucor (NUE +3.6%) shares are enjoying the extra benefit of receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $78 price target at Morgan Stanley.
    • Stanley analyst Evan Kurtz sees a "couple of trade case-related catalysts," with the Trump administration expected to apply tariffs on additional categories of Chinese steel, and expects the construction market, which accounts for more than half of NUE's shipments, growing 4% this year.
    • Kurtz says that while NUE would benefit from a favorable ruling on ongoing rebar and plate trade cases, he is concerned that AK Steel’s (AKS +0.2%) electrical steel exposure, heavy auto steel exposure may become headwinds in 2017, and he downgrades the stock to Equal Weight from Overweight with an $11 price target.
    • Kurtz says his scrap steel contacts expect a rebound in the scrap market, and steel-buyer contacts see healthy U.S. supply and demand; he expects utilization to reach 80% in 2017 vs. 73% in 2016, which he thinks may lead to another round of mill price hikes.
    • The firm retains its Overweight ratings on U.S. Steel (X +5.9%) and Steel Dynamics (STLD +3.1%); SLX +3.6%.

  • DMPI

    DelMar's Phase 2 study assessing VAL-083 in brain cancer underway; shares up 3%

    • The first patient has been dosed in a 48-subject Phase 2 clinical trial assessing DelMar Pharmaceuticals' (DMPI +2.6%) lead product candidate VAL-083 in patients with MGMT-unmethylated Avastin (bevacizumab)-naive recurrent glioblastoma (GBM).
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated final data collection date for the primary endpoint, overall survival, is September 2020. The estimated study completion date is June 2021.
    • About 2/3 of newly diagnosed GBM patients have tumors with an unmethylated MGMT promoter which is correlated with high expression of MGMT, a DNA repair enzyme. These patients have a poor prognosis and are resistant to treatment with alkylating agents like temozolomide, carmustine and lomustin.
    • VAL-083 is a small molecule chemotherapeutic, specifically a bi-functional alkylating agent.

  • BHP

    Global miners move higher alongside copper prices

    • Global mining stocks extend recent gains on the back of stronger metals prices, with copper rising to its highest level since May 2015 as the world's two biggest mines face production stoppages.
    • Shares in BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP), Rio TInto (NYSE:RIO), Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY), Anglo American (OTCQX:AAUKF, OTCPK:AAUKY) and Antofagasta (OTC:ANFGF) are higher by 1.7%-2.2% in London trading; Vale (NYSE:VALE) +4.6%, Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) +2.4%, Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) +1.6% in premarket U.S. trading.
    • Copper recently traded traded at $6,126/metric ton after jumping more than 4% on Friday, its biggest one-day rise in nearly four years.
    • BHP declared force majeure at its Escondida mine in Chile on Friday, and the mine was attacked over the weekend by vandals who forced contract workers to stop work during an ongoing strike.
    • At the same time, exports at FCX's Grasberg site in Indonesia have been suspended for a month.
    • "In the near term, copper prices should continue to trade on headlines from Escondida as well as from the large Grasberg mine in Indonesia, which is also at risk of production disruptions if an export permit is not granted by the government in the coming weeks," J.P. Morgan says.
    • ETFs: JJC, CPER, CUPM

  • AXON

    Axovant's nelotanserin shows treatment benefit in mid-stage dementia study; shares up 5% premarket

    • Thinly traded Axovant Sciences (NASDAQ:AXON) perks up 5% premarket, albeit on only 800 shares, in response to its announcement of positive interim results (n=11) from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing nelotanserin in patients with Lewy body dementia (LBD).
    • The primary endpoint of the trial, which also includes patients with Parkinson's disease dementia (PDD), is the change from baseline in a rating scale called UPDRS Parts II & III. The preliminary results were statistically valid compared to placebo (p<0.05).
    • The data fell short of statistical significance on an internally developed endpoint that measured episodes of hallucinations using a patient diary.
    • The company intends to expand enrollment to confirm the results. The full study should be completed by mid-year. Complete results will be presented at a future scientific meeting in 2017. A Phase 3 study will commence in H2.
    • Nelotanserin is a highly selective inverse agonist of the 5HT2A receptor, a serotonin receptor associated with motor symptoms and neuropsychiatric disturbances including visual hallucinations.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
